main event: Two individuals spotted a circular, brilliant silver object in the sky northwest of Boise, Idaho, on July 5, 1949.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a 55-gallon oil drum, moving at an estimated speed of 1500 mph at 400,000 ft altitude., The object emitted red or orange-colored smoke that appeared to drift from it., Witnesses noted that there was no sound associated with the object., The sighting lasted for about 1.5 minutes before the object gained altitude and disappeared., Observations were made on a clear evening, shortly after sunset.
witness description: a couple reportedly at a high vantage point on Skyline Boulevard
